item.title: Jaye add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Recognizing power in another does not diminish your own." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "People love a happy ending. So every episode, I will explain once again that I don't like people. And then Mal will shoot someone. Someone we like. And their puppy." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Running a close second [as a writing lesson] was the realization that stopping a piece of work just because it's hard, either emotionally or imaginatively, is a bad idea. Sometimes you have to go on when you don't feel like it, and sometimes you're doing good work when it feels like all you're managing is to shovel shit from a sitting position." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jaye add a quote by James Morrow
item.description: "The odor of bowel wind is known to every human, but the fragrance of book glue has crossed only a fraction of mortal nostrils. And yet it behooves us not to judge the unlettered too harshly. We must stay the impulse to write CHUCKLEHEAD above their doors and carve DOLT upon their tombstones." -- James Morrow

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Make it dark, make it grim, make it tough, but then, for the love of God, tell a joke." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Jaye add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Paul Harding
item.description: "When his grandchildren had been little, they had asked if they could hide inside the clock. Now he wanted to gather them and open himself up and hide them among his ribs and faintly ticking heart." -- Paul Harding

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Jaye Wells
item.description: "I only believed in three things: my right fist, my left fist, and my gut." -- Jaye Wells

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "If you want to write, if you want to create, you must be the most sublime fool that God ever turned out and sent rambling. You must write every single day of your life. You must read dreadful dumb books and glorious books, and let them wrestle in beautiful fights inside your head, vulgar one moment, brilliant the next. You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads. I wish you a wrestling match with your Creative Muse that will last a lifetime. I wish craziness and foolishness and madness upon you. May you live with hysteria, and out of it make fine stories â€” science fiction or otherwise. Which finally means, may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "The good writers touch life often. The mediocre ones run a quick hand over her. The bad ones rape her and leave her for the flies." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Your intuition knows what to write, so get out of the way." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "A book is a loaded gun in the house next door...Who knows who might be the target of the well-read man?" -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "First you jump off the cliff and build your wings on the way down." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "I stand in the mist and cry, thinking of myself standing in the mist and crying, and wondering if I will ever be able to use this experience in a book." -- Erica Jong

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "A word after a word after a word is power." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jaye add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Jaye add a quote by James Michener
item.description: "I love writing. I love the swirl and swing of words as they tangle with human emotions." -- James Michener

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"great writers are indecent people they live unfairly saving the best part for paper.
good human beings save the world so that bastards like me can keep creating art, become immortal. if you read this after I am dead it means I made it." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "If the path before you is clear, you're probably on someone else's." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "All the gods, all the heavens, all the hells, are within you." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "If you want to change the world, you have to change the metaphor." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "The schizophrenic is drowning in the same waters in which the mystic swims with delight. Edgar Cayce made the same observation in his readings" -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Jaye add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "The creative act is not hanging on, but yielding to a new creative movement. Awe is what moves us forward." -- Joseph Campbell
